overview.vision_description: The Asia Pacific Opportunity Zone (APOZ) is a multi-phase, mixed-use development project in Winnie, Texas, combining industrial, residential, commercial, and logistics hubs to support Asia-Pacific manufacturing relocation and U.S. trade growth.
overview.advantage3_description: Near Houston's ports, energy corridor, and I-10 logistics network
overview.priority3_description: Warehousing, bonded storage, customs processing areas
overview.priority4_description: Affordable housing + schools, clinics, retail centers
overview.strategy1_description: For investors seeking QOZ tax benefits
overview.strategy2_description: Family offices, institutional capital, IPO listed company partner
overview.strategy3_description: Designed for securitization of stabilized assets
overview.strategy4_description: Engage Texas state housing funds, federal HUD programs

phase1.title: Phase 1
phase1.intro1: Phase 1 of APOZ is located in Winnie, Texas within both the Qualified Opportunity Zone (QOZ) and Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) designation, creating a unique Asia Pacific Opportunity Zone industrial and logistics hub.
phase1.intro2: This initial phase encompasses approximately 436 acres with planned built area of approximately 400,000 sq ft, focusing on industrial warehouses, manufacturing facilities, and bonded logistics operations.
phase1.positioning1: The project strategically leverages FTZ-171 benefits for duty-free imports and exports, while being located within a Qualified Opportunity Zone to provide significant tax advantages for investors.
phase1.positioning2: This positioning makes APOZ ideal for Asia-Pacific manufacturers looking to relocate or expand into the U.S. market, offering both operational cost savings and favorable investment structures.
phase1.objective1: Infrastructure Development: Roads, utilities, data connectivity
phase1.objective2: Anchor Tenants: Attract initial manufacturing & distribution tenants
phase1.objective3: Financial Close: Raise funds via QOF, REITs, and strategic LPs
phase1.objective4: Regulatory Activation: FTZ approval, environmental permits, construction readiness
phase1.timeline1_keyActions: Land clearing, grading, and initial utilities
phase1.timeline2_keyActions: Roads, drainage, power, water, fiber installation
phase1.financing_source1: Equity via QOF (~30–40%): Tax-advantaged capital from QOZ investors seeking capital gains deferral and potential elimination
phase1.financing_source2: Strategic LPs / Family Offices (~15–20%): Private equity partners seeking stable returns enhanced by FTZ operational advantages
phase1.financing_source3: Bank Debt & Construction Loans (~25–35%): Senior debt financing for infrastructure and facility development
phase1.financing_source4: Potential REIT exit or IPO conversion: Long-term liquidity pathway for stabilized assets
phase1.financing_returnsSummary: Phase 1 delivers attractive returns enhanced by both QOZ tax benefits and FTZ operational advantages. QOZ-adjusted IRR provides additional uplift for qualified investors through capital gains tax deferral and potential elimination after 10+ years, while FTZ-enhanced EBITDA growth delivers operational advantages through duty savings and streamlined customs operations.

phase2.title: Phase 2: APOZ Residential Village
phase2.subtitle: Affordable Workforce Housing & Community Development
phase2.overview1: Phase 2 shifts focus to the Residential Village: ~2,000 affordable housing units designed to serve the workforce employed in Phase 1's industrial park and beyond. These units will be developed in a QOZ-designated area, leveraging tax-advantaged capital (QOF) alongside Low-Income Housing Tax Credits (LIHTC), private LPs, and institutional debt.
phase2.overview2: The goal is to create quality, affordable, and sustainable housing that supports economic mobility, stabilizes land values, and generates a recurring revenue stream through rental income and eventual build-to-sell conversions.
phase2.objective1: Workforce Demand: Provide attainable housing for the ~2,000+ workers generated by the industrial park, retail, and logistics facilities in Phase 1.
phase2.objective2: Stabilize Land Value: Develop the residential component to elevate surrounding property values and attract complementary commercial services.
phase2.objective3: Leverage QOZ Incentives: Tap into Qualified Opportunity Zone benefits to defer, reduce, or eliminate capital gains taxes on appreciation.
phase2.objective4: Promote Community Integration: Incorporate walkable streets, community centers, green spaces, and easy connections to Phase 1's employment hubs.
phase2.scope_unitType3: A mix of rental and eventual for-sale (Build-to-Rent, then Build-to-Sell strategies)
phase2.scope_communityFeature1: Pocket parks, playgrounds, and community gathering spaces
phase2.scope_communityFeature3: Pedestrian-friendly pathways linking to transit and Phase 1 employment centers
phase2.scope_landUse: ~200+ acres, with potential expansion zones for commercial/retail pads
phase2.financing_source1: QOF Equity (~30–40%): Tax-advantaged capital from QOZ investors seeking deferral, reduction, or elimination of capital gains.
phase2.financing_source2: LIHTC Syndication (~15–25%): Tax credit equity sold to institutional buyers (banks, corporations) in exchange for project equity.
phase2.financing_source3: Private LPs & Co-Investors (~15–20%): Family offices, impact investors, and institutional partners seeking stable yields + social returns.
phase2.financing_source4: Senior Debt & Construction Loans (~25–35%): Bank financing (HUD, Freddie Mac, Fannie Mae multi-family programs) at favorable rates given the QOZ and LIHTC structure.
phase2.timeline1_keyActions: Finalize site plan, zoning approvals, LIHTC application, QOF structuring
phase2.timeline2_keyActions: Close on QOF equity, LIHTC syndication, debt financing; begin site prep and foundation work
phase2.timeline3_keyActions: First ~800–1,000 units under construction (apartments and townhomes)
phase2.timeline4_keyActions: First buildings complete; marketing and lease-up to Phase 1 workforce and local families
phase2.timeline5_keyActions: Build out remaining ~1,000+ units; expand retail/commercial pads; finalize community amenities
phase2.timeline6_keyActions: Reach full occupancy; evaluate REIT conversion, refinance, or phased for-sale transitions
phase2.synergy1: Phase 1 Employment Anchor: Industrial tenants generate steady workforce demand, ensuring high occupancy and minimal vacancy risk.
phase2.synergy2: Integrated Community: Workers live, work, and shop within a walkable, master-planned ecosystem—reducing commute times and increasing quality of life.
phase2.synergy3: Land Value Uplift: Successful Phase 1 operations boost surrounding land values, making Phase 2 Residential development more feasible and profitable.
phase2.synergy4: Dual QOZ Benefits: Both phases leverage QOZ tax incentives, multiplying investor appeal and creating compounding financial advantages.
